text: Glaring out over the city at the setting sun is a handsom muscular MAN with intense, evil eyes. This is IMHOTEP.
Home of Imhotep, High Priest of  Osiris, Keeper of the Dead.

A gorgeous, olive-skinned goddess enters the outer foyer. takes us a moment to realize that the skin-tight dress sh wearing isn't a dress at all, but rather her entire naked body has been PAINTED in the ancient Egyptian manner She' stunning sight to behold. This is ANCK-SU-NAMUN.
Birthplace of Anck-su-namun. Pharaoh's  Mistress. No other man was allowed  to touch her.

She makes her way through the ornate statuary. The CAMERA comes to a stop on a CRACKED STONE FACE. A BEAT. And then it's eyes suddenly POP OPEN. It's really a strange lookin TATTOOED MAN. Several more of these hideous, bald MEN sta nearby. They are the PRIESTS of Osiris. Imhotep's guys. T eyes watch Anck-su-namun vanish through the bedroom curta Anck-su-namun embraces Imhotep, they kiss passionately,  feverishly. Imhotep's hands roam over her perfect body,  smearing the paint. The Narrator's VOICE fills with lust:
But for our love, we were willing to  risk life itself.

And we realize that the Narrator is actually Imhotep hims on the other-side of the curtains, the bald Priests rush  over and close the doors. But just as they do, the doors  suddenly BURST OPEN. Pharaoh angrily strides in, looks at the Priests. The following DIALOGUE is in ANCIENT EGYPTIA SUBTITLED.
What are you doing here?

The Priests back away, scared shitless, obviously his arr was unexpected. Pharaoh strides for the curtains. Throws  them back. Anck-su-namun stands alone. Gives him a sexy smile. Phara sees the smeared body paint. Points his finger.
WHO HAS TOUCHED YOU?!
From behind him, his sword is ripped out of its scabbard. Pharaoh spins around. It's Imhotep. Pharaoh is shocked.
Imhotep?... My priest.

Behind him, Anck-su-namun lifts a dagger and plunges it i his back. Pharaoh SCREAMS. Imhotep raises Pharaoh's sword. The hide bald Priests SLAM the doors and bolt them tight. Through curtains, they see the SHADOWS of Anck-su-namun and Imhot stab away at Pharaoh. Suddenly, the doors are RAMMED from the other side, --WHAM! Imhotep and Anck-su-namun turn an look. --WHAM! The doors are RAMMED again. The two lovers  share desperate looks. --WHAM! The bald Priests run up an grab Imhotep and try and pull him towards the balcony.
Pharaoh's bodyguards!
Imhotep tries to break free, but Anck-su-namun rips Phara sword out of his hand and pushes him towards the balcony.
You must go. Save yourself. Only you  can resurrect me.

Imhotep's face fills with despair. The DOORS EXPLODE OPEN MEN with BLUE-TINTED SKIN and strange PUZZLE-TATTOOS over their bodies stride in, armed to the teeth. These are the MUMIA. The Priests hustle Imhotep out onto the dark balco just as the Mumia rip through the curtains. Anck-su-namun points at Pharaoh and hisses --
My body is no longer his temple!
She PLUNGES the sword into her own heart. Out on the balc Imhotep's mouth opens into a horrible silent scream...
For murdering Pharaoh, Anck-su-namun's  body was to be cursed. And it was I,  the High Priest, whose duty it was  to curse it.
Imhotep leads-a TORCH-LIT procession across the dunes. An su-namun's mummy is carried by NUBIAN SLAVES. They put he down in the sand along with FIVE JEWEL ENCRUSTED JARS.
Her body was mummified, her vital  organs removed and placed in sacred  canopic jars.
Imhotep, filled with dread, reads from a OBOOKO made out pure GOLD. THIS IS THE BOOK OF THE LIVING.
The Book of The Living contained  sacred incantations that would send  the evil dead on a journey into the  dark underworld.

Strange LIGHT suddenly FLASHES across the faces of the sl and the EGYPTIAN SOLDIERS. Suddenly, everyone's fear-fill eyes all rise, as if watching Anck-su-namun's body rising Then one last HUGE FLASH, accompanied by a BLAST OF WIND, and it's over. Anck-su-namun's body now lies twisted on t ground. Imhotep's Priests place the body into a stone sarcophagus The Nubian slaves lower it into a hole and bury it with s Imhotep then signals to the Soldiers, who throw their spe at the Nubians. Killing them.
The slaves were killed...
Imhotep's knife-wielding Priests attack the now unarmed  Soldiers, hacking at them in the flickering darkness as  Imhotep and the Mumia solemnly watches.
...and the soldiers who killed them  were also slain, so that no unholy  person should ever know the exact  location of the burial site.

The Mumia walk off across the sand and then, one by one, Priests stop their frenzied stabbing and stare off at the vanishing Mumia. As the last Mumia disappears over a dist dune, Imhotep nods, and the Priests leap onto Anck-su-nam grave and begin digging it back up with their hands.
CHARIOTS race out into the moonlit desert. Imhotep leads way. A "hearse" carries Anck-su-namun's mummy. THE MAP OF ANCIENT EGYPT FADES UP. The chariots race across the map.
But there was another book, The Book  Of The Dead, which was never to be  opened, never to be read, for it  contained the incantations that could  bring a dead body back to life a  most unholy thing.
The chariots arrive at a place marked on the map in hiera They race up the stone ramp and in through the city gates SUPERIMPOSED across the SCREEN are the WORDS: HAMUNAPTRA - City of the Dead
It was hidden at Hamunaptra, City of  the Dead, inside the statue of Anubis,  so that no such sacrilege might ever  disgrace Egypt.
Imhotep pulls an ORNATE CHEST out of a SECRET COMPARTMENT inside the giant STATUE OF ANUBIS. He opens the chest and lifts out THE BOOK OF THE DEAD, made of black stone.
But for my love of Anck-su-namun I  was willing to defy the gods.

Big hairy RATS scurry through the mausoleums and over the headstones of this very large, scary, UNDERGROUND CEMETER A DETRITUS MOAT surrounds the cemetery, -- muck made out filthy water and human remains. Skulls bob in the goop. T Priests have gathered in a circle. Their hooded, lifeless eyes seem dead to this world. Their bald heads rock back forth as they CHANT, a quiet eerie HUM. Heinous creatures In the middle of the circle is a strange, twisted ALTAR. Imhotep has unwrapped Anck-su-namun's gorgeous, lifeless  body and placed her five sacred canopic jars around her.
Anck-su-namun's vital organs were  still fresh, so a human sacrifice  would not need be made.

As Imhotep begins to read from The Book of The Dead, a la SWIRLING HOLE starts to open in the detritus bog. Several Priests look over at it, frightened, then quickly look ba down and resume CHANTING. A strange MIST wafts up out of swirling hole and over to the jars, it passes through the and into Anck-su-namun's body. One of the jars SHUDDERS, heart inside begins to BEAT. The CHANTING PRIESTS, SWIRLI HOLE, WAFTING MIST, BEATING HEART and IMHOTEP'S READINGS reaching a crescendo. Anck-su-namun's EYES suddenly FLY O
Anck-su-namun soul had come back  from the dead! Now all that was  needed, was to return her organs to  their rightful place within her body.

Imhotep lifts a sacrificial knife above Anck-su-namun's  breast, about to plunge it down. The CHANTING, SWIRLING a BEATING heart CLIMAX. And that's when the Mumia BURST IN storm through the startled Priests. The HEAD MUMIA SMASHE the jar with the beating heart. The MIST instantly sucks  back out of Anck-su-namun's body and IMPLODES back into t swirling hole. Anck-su-namun's eyes close. Dying once again. Imhotep SCR in rage. The Mumia grab him and his Priests.
My Priests were condemned to be  mummified alive.

Inside a TORCH-LIT CHAMBER, Imhotep is held by Anubis-hea EMBALMERS. He cringes at the flickering, impressionistic  glimpses of his Priests being embalmed and mummified aliv The horrid-looking Embalmers, using knives, needles and  thread, calmly perform their ghastly surgery on the SCREA Priests, who are going insane from the procedure. A red hot POKER is pulled out of a pit of burning coals. A Priest's head is wedged between two strong boards. His  eyes widen in terror as an Embalmer moves to insert the r hot poker up his nose. But just before he does, WE QUICKLY CUT TO IMHOTEP'S FACE horrified, as OFF CAMERA, the Priest SCREAMS. WE GO WIDE on the chamber. All twenty-one of Imhotep's Pr squirm inside their wrappings. Imhotep is forced to his k His arms are held back. His mouth is pried open.
As for me, I was condemned to endure  the HOM-DAI. The worst of all ancient  curses. One so horrible, it had never  before been bestowed.

Using a pair of tongs, an Embalmer slowly pulls Imhotep's TONGUE out of his mouth, then places a very sharp knife o top of it. WE GO TIGHT on IMHOTEP'S EYES as his tongue is apparently cut out. The Embalmer flings Imhotep's tongue  onto the floor. The Mumia's dogs attack and quickly eat i Imhotep is WRAPPED ALIVE. Only his mouth, nostrils and  fearfilled eyes are left free of the slimy bandages. Detr muck boils inside a black cauldron. Embalmers scoop out t fetid muck and apply it to Imhotep's wrappings as he squi He's then laid in a wooden COFFIN inside a stone SARCOPHA An Embalmer with a BUCKET steps up and looks into the cof Imhotep's wild eyes stare back. The Embalmer empties the  bucket over Imhotep's chest: dozens of SCARABS, disgustin dung beetles. They scurry across Imhotep's SCREAMING face Some vanish into his tongue-less mouth and up his nostril
By eating the sacred scarabs, I would  be cursed to stay alive forever. And  by eating me, they were cursed just  the same.

The lid to the coffin is SLAMMED SHUT. Then, using a stra four-sided KEY, the Head Mumia locks the coffin lid tight The heavy sarcophagus lid is shoved into place and with a loud WHOOSH seals itself airtight. Once again, the Head M uses the strange key, locking the sarcophagus lid tight.
I was to remain sealed inside my  sarcophagus, the undead for all of  eternity.
The blue-skinned, strangely tattooed man carefully collap the sides of the key, -- turning it into a little puzzle  BOX.

They would never allow me to be  released. For I would arise a walking  disease, a plague upon mankind, an  unholy flesh-eater, with the strength  of ages, power over the sands, and  the glory of invincibility.
Imhotep's sarcophagus is dropped into a DETRITUS PIT. The disgusting muck SPLASHES up, drools down it-s sides, and  then is mysteriously sucked into It's seams, vanishing cl
And if I could raise my beloved Anck- su-namun from her place in hell,  together, we would be an unstoppable  infection upon this world. The  Apocalypse. The End.
Imhotep's horrifying tongue-less SCREAMS can be heard com from inside his sarcophagus as grave diggers shovel dirt  onto it. THE MAIN TITLE IS SUPERIMPOSED ON THE SCREAM:

The heavily armed Mumia stand guard around Imhotep's grav Looking down on the burial site is the huge statue of ANU the jackal-headed god of death. It stares at us. Then beg to DECAY before our very eyes, aging 4,159 years in only  seconds. And then we find ourselves and the decrepit, hal buried statue of Anubis out in the middle of the desert.
Imhotep's horrifying SCREAMS become the SCREAMS of a TUAR HORSEMAN. Racing across the desert with two thousand of his warrior brethren. Armed to the teeth. SUPERIMPOSED across the SCR are the WORDS:

A mile across the scorching desert TWO HUNDRED FRENCH FOR LEGIONNAIRES scurry through the ruins, preparing for the  onslaught. OUR HERO is up on the wall. His Kepi sits at a jaunty angle. Dashing and handsome. This is RICK O'CONNEL He looks out at the massive SCREAMING horde galloping at  him.
I knew this was gonna be a lousy  day.
A doughy little Frenchman joins him as he makes his way a the top of the wall. This is BENI.
Personally, I would like to surrender.  Why can we not just surrender?
Shut-up and gimme your bandolier.
Beni pulls off his cartridge belt. Hands it to O'Connell.
Then let's run away. Right now. While  we can still make it.
O'Connell throws it on, crisscrossing his own bandolier.
Now gimme your revolver, you'll never  use it anyway.
Beni pulls out his pistol and chucks it to O'Connell.
Then let's play dead, huh? Nobody  ever does that anymore.
O'Connell slides it into his belt, next to his own revolv
Now go find me a big stick.
In the desert? What for?
O'Connell turns and goes nose-to-nose with him.
So I can tie it to your back, you  appear to be without a spine.
The horde of warriors THUNDERS forward. Now a half mile o Scimitars RATTLING. O'Connell and Beni run through the ru
How'd a guy like you end up in the  Legion anyways?
I got caught robbing a synagogue.  Lots of good stuff in them holy  places; churches, temples, mosques,  and who's guarding them?
Altar boys?
Exactly! I speak seven languages,  including Hebrew, so my specialty  was synagogues. How about you? Kill  somebody?
Beni trips and accidentally tackles O'Connell to the grou O'Connell gives him a nasty look.
No, but I'm considering it.
They get up and run out the gate and down the stone ramp
What then? Robbery? Extortion?  Kidnapping!
None of the above, thank you.
Then what the hell are you doing  here!?
They both skid to a stop at the front line as they see th horde of warriors. The SOUND of CHARGING HORSES is deafen O'Connell gives Beni a big cheesy smile.
I was just looking for a good time.
And that's when the cowardly Legionnaire Colonel suddenly panics, cuts and runs. O'Connell instantly stiffens.
Oh shit. Steady!
Gives the men around him courage. But onward comes the ho Hoofs pounding the sand. Several more Legionnaires take o
STEADY! (to himself) What the hell am I sayin'?
The Tuaregs let loose with those horrifying oooo-loo-loog SCREAMS. More Legionnaires haul-ass. Beni is one of them.
STEADY!! (to himself) What the hell am I doin'?
The Tuaregs set their rifles and take aim. O'Connell stee himself, cocks and locks. The cartridge in his mouth sudd snaps, he spits it into the sand. Another BEAT. And then
FIRE!
The Legionnaires on the ground FIRE. The rifles report wi a CRASH. The BLAST blows dozens of Tuaregs clean off thei mounts. The prone Legionnaires quickly begin to reload.
FIRE!
The kneeling Legionnaires FIRE. More Tuaregs bite the san The remaining warriors OPEN FIRE. THUNDER and SMOKE rip t hot air. A third of the Legionnaires are killed instantly
FIRE!

The remaining standing Legionnaires FIRE. Tuaregs spin of their mounts. Crash to the sand. And then the entire Tuar force plows into the ruins and through the Legionnaires. O'Connell grabs the barrel of his rifle and starts CLUBBI riders off their steeds, fighting like a man possessed. Beni on the other hand, is bellycrawling across the sand, whimpering in full retreat as Legionnaires fall dead all  around him. He crawls through the front gate. O'Connell throws his rifle down and goes for his guns. He cross-draws, gun in each hand, starts blowing riders off  their mounts. Beni crawls faster, and then he spots an open TEMPLE DOOR amongst the rocks. He gets up and sprints for the door as the last of the Legionnaires are shot off their feet behi him. O'Connell's guns go empty.
Son-of-a-bitch.

He turns and runs like hell, right through the front gate Four Tuareg warriors on massive Arabians haul-ass after h O'Connell hurdles a stone column, hits the ground running He spots Beni inside the Temple doorway, trying to close heavy sandstone door.
Hey! Beni! Wait up!
Beni has no intention of waiting up, he pushes harder.
What are ya doing?! Wait up!
O'Connell runs faster. Beni pushes harder. The four Horse LEAP the big column and CHARGE after him. HOOFS POUNDING.
Don't you close that door! DON'T YOU  CLOSE THAT DOOR!
Beni closes the door just as O'Connell reaches it. O'Conn SLAMS his body into the door. It doesn't budge.
I'm gonna get you for this!

He turns and bolts off around the rocks. Running for his  life, weaving through the ruins. The Arabians getting clo and closer. The POUNDING hoofs getting LOUDER and LOUDER. O'Connell finally spins around and faces his attackers. T four massive horses crash to a stop in front of him. The  vicious Tuaregs raise their rifles to finish him off. O'Connell just stands there, exhausted and beaten, then h slowly lifts his right hand and gives them the bird. And that's when the horses go ape-shit. All four of them  REAR UP. Two of the Riders are THROWN to the ground. The  horses SCREECH and BELLOW and SNORT in fear, then buck li fury and haul-ass away as if the devil himself had scared them. The thrown Riders get up and race off after their  mounts. O'Connell just stands there, stunned, then he lifts his r hand and checks out his middle finger. And then he feels evil himself, and turns around. -- The shattered, decrepi statue of Anubis stares back at him. Suddenly, the sand begins to shift under O'Connell's feet He starts to back away, keeping his eyes on the transform sand, it looks like huge snakes are wiggling and writhing beneath it, forming lines and shapes, -- drawing a pictur O'Connell quickly turns and runs off through the ruins. T sand stops moving, and we can now see that, drawn in the  sand, is a picture of IMHOTEP'S SCREAMING FACE.

Up on a ridge, A GROUP OF RIDERS watch O'Connell stumble  clear of the decrepit city. O'Connell feels their presenc and looks up. Very different from the Tuaregs, they have  BLUE TINTED SKIN and faces covered in strange PUZZLE-TATT The Mumia. Still watching Imhotep's grave after all this  time. The MUMIA LEADER is a huge, fierce Man in black robes, wi dual scimitars across his waist. His face is both handsom and horrible, blue and tattooed. Meet ARDETH RAY. His dar eyes watch O'Connell stagger off into the open desert...

Cairo, a city so old the stars have actually changed thei positions in the sky since it's birth. A city teeming wit every form of life. A strange, mysterious, wonderful city WE SUPERIMPOSE it's name across the SCREEN:

Deep in the bowels of the museum lie the STACKS. Rows upo rows of towering bookshelves. Filled with literature on t Antiquities. Standing at the top of a tall ladder between two of these rows and leaning against one of the bookshel is a rather uninteresting British GIRL: eye-glasses, hair a-bun, long boring dress, your typical prudish nightmare. This is EVELYN CARNARVON. We're going to fall in love wit her. Evelyn pulls a book out from a stack under her arm, blows the dust off it, then places it on a shelf with other boo whose titles all begin with the letter "O". Then she grab another book out from under her arm and reads the title.
Tuthmosis?... Now how did you get up  here?

Carefully, so as not to lose her balance, she looks over shoulder to the bookshelf behind her, where all the title begin with the letter "T". Then she looks down. It's a lo way to the bottom. Evelyn gently sets the other books dow on the top shelf, then turns and gingerly starts to reach across the aisle with the Tuthmosis book. It's a little t far, so she stretches, reaching, holding the top of the l with her fingertips, she's almost got it, closer now clos And that's when the ladder pulls away from the shelf. Eve YELPS, flings the Tuthmosis book and grabs the top of the ladder, which stands straight up. Evelyn holds her breath swaying precariously, a long BEAT, and then she loses her balance, the ladder swings around and Evelyn starts  stiltwalking down the aisle.
OHEIUGM!! AHHHHHH!

The ladder crosses the aisle, does an about face and head back the way it came. Evelyn clings to the top, strugglin for balance. The ladder teeters out into the main aisle a picks up speed. Evelyn SCREAMS as it does a 180, spins in another aisle and finally crashes to a stop at the top of bookshelf. Evelyn holds her breath, then SIGHS HEAVILY. And that's when the bookshelf falls away from her and CRA into the next bookshelf. Evelyn slides down the ladder and plops to the floor. She looks up just as the domino effect kicks-in: each bookshe crashing into the next. And onward it goes. Bookshelf aft bookshelf. Thousands of volumes flinging off shelves and  scattering across the floor. It finally ends as the last  shelf CRASHES into a wall. Evelyn's eyes are closed. She  opens one eye. Looks left. Then right. Then opens the oth eye and stares at the huge mess.
Oops.
The Egyptian CURATOR storms in.
Look at this! Sons of the Messiah!  Give me frogs, flies, locusts,  anything but this! Compared to you,  the other plagues were a joy!
Evelyn quickly gets up and starts gathering books.
I'm sorry, it was an accident.
When Ramesses destroyed Syria, it  was an accident. You are a  catastrophe! Why do I put up with  you?
Evelyn turns to him, trying to contain herself.

You put up with me, because I can  read and write ancient Egyptian,  decipher hieroglyphs and hieratic,  and I'm the only person within a  thousand miles who knows how to  properly code and catalogue this  library.
Who needs smart women? I put up with  you because your mother and father  were our finest patrons, Allah rest  their souls. Now straighten up this  mess!
The Curator storms out. Evelyn just stands there, steamin And then she hears a NOISE and quickly turns around. A BE
Hello?
Quiet. Eerie. And then she hears it again, like feet, slo shuffling across the floor, coming from a nearby gallery.
Abdul? Mohammed? Bob?
Evelyn walks through the stacks and enters --

Filled with treasures and plunder from the Middle Kingdom It's very dark and quiet in here, the only LIGHT is from  FLICKERING TORCHES at either end of the spooky gallery. The NOISE again! From the far side of the room. Feet, slo shuffling, plodding across the floor. Evelyn grabs a torc Looks around, at a statue of Anubis, another of Horus, th stare down at Evelyn, who is starting to get scared now. walks down the aisle. Past a closed sarcophagus. Past cas of ancient artifacts. Past another sarcophagus, -- only t one is OPEN! Evelyn freezes, swallows hard, nervously loo around to see who could have opened it. Then she slowly l forward with the torch, and peers inside. -- A hideous rotted MUMMY sits up and SCREECHES at her! Evelyn SCREAMS, drops the torch and backs away, scared ou of her wits. And then, coming from inside the sarcophagus she hears a Man LAUGHING. Her eyes narrow as a foppish ca crawls out from behind the Mummy, laughing his ass off, h drunk.
You...! YOU...!
Drunkard? Fool? Rat-bastard? Please  call me something original.
Meet JONATHAN CARNARVON. As he crawls out of the sarcopha Evelyn pulls a cigarette out of the mummy's mouth.
Have you no respect for the dead?
Right now, I only wish to join them.
He grins drunkenly. Evelyn punches him hard in the chest.
Well I wish you'd do it sooner rather  than later, before you ruin my career  the way you've ruined yours.
My dear, sweet, baby sister, I'll  have you know, that at this moment  my career is on a high note.
He BELCHES, then falls back and sits on the edge of a tom
High note? Ha! For five years you've  been scrounging around Egypt, and  what have you to show for it? Nothing.
Jonathan excitedly starts scrounging around in his jacket
Oh yes I do! I have something right  here!
Oh no, not another worthless trinket,  Jonathan, if I bring one more piece  of junk to the Curator to try and  sell for you.
Jonathan pulls out a small, ancient BOX; the collapsed KE to Imhotep's sarcophagus and coffin. Evelyn is instantly  curious, she grabs the box out of his hand.
Where did you get this?
Jonathan knows her weaknesses, gives her a mischievous sm
On a dig, down in Thebes.
Evelyn rolls the box around in her hands, mumbling to her as she translates the hieratics and hieroglyphs covering Jonathan licks his lips in anticipation.
My whole life I've never found  anything, Evy. Tell me I've found  something.

Evelyn's fingers play with the various little slats on th box, shifting them this way and that way, it's like a puz box. Then suddenly, it UNFOLDS ITSELF, almost-mechanicall turning itself into the KEY. Sitting inside the open key/ is a folded piece of GOLDEN PAPYRUS. An ANCIENT MAP.
Jonathan?
Yes?
I think you found something.
The Curator sits at his desk, staring through a jeweler's eyepiece at the key/box. Evelyn hovers behind him, excite
See the cartouche there, it's the  official royal seal of Seti the First,  I'm sure of it.
Perhaps.
Jonathan leans in from across the desk.
Two questions. Who the hell is Seti  the First? And was he rich?
He was the last Pharaoh of the Old  Kingdom, said to be the wealthiest  Pharaoh of them all.
Alright, good, that's good. I like  this fellow, like him very much.
The Curator picks up the MAP. It's actually the exact sam map that we established in the opening scenes of the movi
I've already dated it, this map is  almost four thousand years old. And  the hieratics over here... (Inhales deeply) It's Hamunaptra.
The Curator freezes, suddenly very nervous, then he recov
My dear girl, don't be ridiculous,  we are scholars, not treasure hunters.  Hamunaptra is a myth.
Are we talking about the Hamunaptra?
Yes. The City of The Dead. Where the  early Pharaohs were said to have  hidden the wealth of Egypt.

Right, right, in a big underground  treasure chamber. Everybody knows  the story. The entire necropolis was  rigged to sink into the sand. On  Pharaoh's command, a flick of the  switch! And the whole place could  disappear beneath the dunes.
All we know is that the city  mysteriously vanished around 2,134  B.C.
The Curator holds the map closer to the burning CANDLE-LA
As the Americans would say: it's all  fairy tales and hokum.
The map 'accidentally,' CATCHES ON FIRE. The Curator thro it to the floor. Jonathan drops to his knees and quickly  puts it out. Lifts it up. The left third of the map is no missing.
You burned it! You burned off the  part with the lost city!
It's for the best, I'm sure. Many  men have wasted their lives in the  foolish pursuit of Hamunaptra, no  one has ever found it, most have  never returned.
(devastated) You killed my map.
I'm sure it was a fake, anyway, I'm  surprised at you, Miss Carnarvon, to  be so fooled.
The Curator reaches for the key/box. Evelyn quickly snatc it off the desk and gives him a very angry, suspicious lo

Cairo prison. One of the worst hell holes on earth. Every low-life form of scumbag can be found here. The WARDEN, a first rate scumbag himself, escorts Evelyn and Jonathan a the gallows courtyard. Evelyn whispers to Jonathan.
You told me you found it on a dig  down in Thebes!
I was mistaken.
You lied to me!
I lie to everybody, what makes you  so special?
I'm your sister.
That just makes you more gullible.
You stole it from a drunk at the  local Casbah?!
Picked his pocket, actually.
The Warden ushers Evelyn and Jonathan into the holding pe
And what is he in prison for?
I did not know, so when I heard you  were coming, I asked him that myself.
And what did he say?
He said... he was just looking for a  good time.

The interior cell door BURSTS OPEN. O'Connell is in chain dragged by FOUR GUARDS, they shove him up to the cell bar From the looks of it, he's been here awhile; his face is  half hidden by long hair, a scraggly beard and many new  bruises. Evelyn looks at him, disgusted by his appearance
But he's just a filthy criminal?
(cringing) Way to go, Evy.
O'Connell gives Evelyn the once over, then looks at Jonat
So who's the broad?
Broad?!
She's my sister, actually.
Yeah? Well,... I'm sure she's not a  total loss.
Evelyn is stunned and furious. The Warden heads out the d
I'll be back in a moment.
(sarcastic) I tremble with anticipation.
A Guard CLUBS O'Connell across the head, O'Connell's face bounces off the metal bars. He shows no pain, but just lo back and gives the Guard a nasty look. Evelyn steps close
We uh,... found... your puzzle box,  and we've come to ask you about it.
No.
No?
No... You came to ask me about  Hamunaptra.
Evelyn and Jonathan quickly look around, hoping the guard didn't hear him. They step closer. Evelyn plays coy.
How do you know the box pertains to  Hamunaptra?
Because that's where I found it. I  was there.
Evelyn is dumbstruck. But Jonathan looks suspicious
How do we know that's not a load of  pig swallow?
O'Connell looks closer at Jonathan, a glint of recognitio
Hey,... don't I know you?
Um, well, you see...

O'Connell's FIST comes flying through the bars, hits Jona square in the jaw, DECKS HIM. He hits the floor. Out cold Guard CLUBS O'Connell. His head bounces off the bars agai He shows no pain, but gives the Guard another nasty look. Evelyn looks down at her brother, then back at O'Connell.
You were actually at Hamunaptra?
I just decked your brother
Yes, well... (shrugs) I know my brother.
O'Connell almost smiles. There's a bit of spark to this g
Yeah, I was there.
You swear?
Every damn day.
No, I mean --
-- I know what you mean. I was there,  alright. Seti's place. The City Of  The Dead.
What did you find? What did you see?
I found sand. I saw death.
The warden enters. Evelyn quickly leans closer to O'Conne
Could you tell me how to get there?  The exact location?
Want to know?
Evelyn leans in even closer.
Yes.
Really want to know?
She leans her face right up to the bars, nervous and exci
Yes.
O'Connell steps forward and KISSES her full on the lips.
Then get me the hell outta here.
Evelyn is stunned. A Guard CLUBS him, his face bounces of the bars again, but before he can react the Guards GRAB h YANKS him away from the bars and DRAG him out of the room
Where are they taking him?
To be hanged.
Evelyn is shocked. The warden shows-off his green teeth.
Apparently, he had a very good time.

Hundreds of filthy PRISONERS stare down onto the gallows the hangman's noose is draped over O'Connell's head and  cinched tight around his neck. Evelyn follows the warden  onto a balcony above the gallows. The prisoners all go de quiet at the sight of her; like jackals staring at fresh  meat.
No women allowed.
I am an English woman.
This seems to confuse the Warden, he shrugs and sits down O'Connell looks up as Evelyn plops down beside the Warden
I will give you one hundred pounds  to spare his life.
I would pay one hundred pounds just  to see him hang.
Two hundred pounds.
Proceed!
Three hundred pounds!
O'Connell can hear every word, he looks hopeful. Other th Evelyn, you could hear a pin drop. The HANGMAN turns to h
Any last requests, pig?
Yeah, I'd like ya to let me go.
The Hangman grabs the lever to the trapdoor.
FIVE HUNDRED POUNDS!
The Warden sets his greasy, lecherous hand on Evelyn's le
And what else?
Evelyn is revolted, she quickly shoves his hand away. Insulted, the Warden angrily turns and gestures to the  Hangman, who pulls the lever. The trapdoor DROPS AWAY.
NOOO!
O'Connell DROPS through the hole. The rope pays out. Then JERKS TAUGHT. O'Connell's body SNAPS at the end of the ro But he's still alive, because --
His neck did not break! Good! Now we  watch him strangle to death.

The prisoners go ape-shit, SCREAMING and SHOUTING in ange The GUARDS look around, nervous. O'Connell struggles at t end of the rope, gagging. Evelyn is horrified, she quickl turns to the warden, leans forward and whispers in his ea
He knows the location to Hamunaptra.
The warden spins around and faces her.
You lie.
I would never!
At the end of the rope, O'Connell is choking and gagging turning several shades of red. The Warden stares at Evely
Are you saying this filthy godless  son of a pig knows where to find The  City Of The Dead? Truly?
Yes and if you cut him down, we will  give you ten percent.
Fifty percent.
Twenty.
Forty.
Evelyn hesitates, bites her lip. O'Connell's eyes bulge a he looks up at her, he can't believe this girl.
Give... give him... give him GLAAAA-- !
Twenty-five percent, and not one  single farthing more.

The warden flashes a big green smile, then YELLS in Arabi A scimitar SLASHES the air. The rope is CUT. O'Connell CR to the ground. Half dead. Rolls over. GAGGING. All of the prisoners BURST INTO CHEERS. O'Connell looks u at Evelyn. She smiles broadly and waves down at him.
CANDLE LIGHT FLICKERS across the Curator's face.
She must die.
Standing in the shadows across from his desk are THREE MU blue tinted skin, hideous facial tattoos, -- the works. O of the Mumia has a rusty metal HOOK for a hand. He shrugs
She is like all the others. She will  die in the desert.
No! She has seen too much. She knows  too much.
The Curator leans across his desk, fear in his eyes.
Not only does she have a map, but  she has the key.
Spooks the hell out of the Mumia guys.
The key!? She has the lost key!?
Yes. No one has ever had so much,  been so close. We must stop her, or  it will be the end of us all.
Then we will kill her, we will kill  her and all those with her.
And burn the map and retrieve the  key.
It will be done. But what of the  American expedition? They leave  tomorrow as well.
Forget the bumbling Americans, they  will be like all the others. Without  the map to guide them, how can they  possibly find Hamunaptra?
SMASH CUT TO: our old traitorous friend BENI.
It is three days down the Nile, then  two days by camel, sahibs.
WE CRANE BACK: to reveal Beni standing on the bow of a  PASSENGER BARGE. Surrounded by DANIELS, HENDERSON and BUR
For all the money we're paying you,  something better god-damned well be  under that sand.
WE KEEP CRANING BACK: as Henderson slaps Daniels on the b
"Hamunaptra," Daniels, that's all ya  gotta keep sayin, to yourself,  "Hamunaptra."

Now we see all of GIZA PORT: Team of explorers swarm the  docks. Across the Nile, the PYRAMIDS spike the sky. Evely and Jonathan walk along the boardwalk besieged by HAWKERS selling everything from toy tombs to King Tut action figu
Do you really think he'll show up?
Undoubtedly, I know the breed, he  may be a cowboy, but his word is his  word.
Personally, I think he's filthy,  rude and a complete scoundrel. I  don't like him one bit.
Anyone I know?
They both turn. O'Connell walks up; shaved, showered, spi and polished, with a new haircut and clothes. He looks mo dashing and handsome than ever. Evelyn is suitably impres
Oh... um,... hello.
Jonathan grabs O'Connell's arm and shakes his hand.
Smashing day for the start of an  adventure, eh, O'Connell?
O'Connell quickly checks his pockets.
Yeah, sure, smashing.
He finds his wallet and relaxes. DIRECTLY ABOVE HIM: on t bow of the barge, Burns wipes his bifocals and turns to B
You're sure Hamunaptra is out there?
Along with the scorched bones of my  entire garrison, sahib.
And that's when Beni spots O'Connell. Beni shakes his hea as if seeing a mirage, then starts backing away from the  men.
A thousand pardons, my good sahibs  but there is much work to be done.
Beni quickly scurries off, vanishing down into the hold. BACK DOWN WITH: Evelyn, recovering, she clears her throat
Mister O'Connell, can you look me in  the eye, and guarantee me this is  not some sort of flimflam? Because  if it is, I'm warning you --
O'Connell steps up close to Evelyn, invading her space lo her straight in the eye. Evelyn doesn't back away.

All I can tell you, miss, is that my  Colonel found that map in an ancient  fortress, and the whole damn garrison  believed in it so much, that without  orders, we marched halfway across  Libya and into Egypt to find that  city. Like I told ya, all I saw was  sand. Everybody else was wiped out  by Tuareg warriors. I'll take your  bags.
O'Connell takes her bags and heads up the gangplank and o the same passenger barge that Beni and the Americans are Evelyn's eyes follow him, a bit wistfully. Jonathan sees
Yes, yes, you're right, filthy, rude,  a complete scoundrel, nothing to  like there at all.
Evelyn gives him a look. Jonathan just grins. And that's  when the warden suddenly brushes past, tipping his ragged hat.
A bright good morning to all.
What are you doing here?
I have come to protect my investment,  thank you very much.
And up the plank he goes. Evelyn and Jonathan share a loo WE GO WIDE AGAIN: as the barge pulls out and heads down t Nile. WE TILT UP: to the SUN, which then DISSOLVES into -

The MOON, shining down on the desert. The THREE VICIOUS M quietly glide a narrow skiff out onto the river. The one  with the hook sits in the middle of the skiff, the other row, heading for the PASSENGER BARGE coming their way.
Jonathan and the three Americans are playing poker. O'Con comes out a door carrying a GUNNY-SACK.
Sit down, O'Connell, sit down, we  could use another good player.
I only gamble with my life, never my  money.
Never? What if I were to wager five  hundred dollars says we get to  Hamunaptra before you?
O'Connell returns Daniel's cocky look.
Yer on.
Burns slips on his dirty bifocals.
What makes you so confident, sir?
What makes you?
Henderson spits a wad of chew into a spittoon.
We got us a man who's actually been  there.
O'Connell's poker face drops, perplexed. Same with Jonath
I say, what a coincidence, why --
O'Connell 'accidentally' hits him in the ribs with the  gunnysack, shutting him up. Jonathan quickly covers.
-- whose deal is it? Is it my deal?  I thought I just dealt?
Evelyn sits on a table, staring out over the passing rive The gunny-sack DROPS onto the table, startling her.
Sorry, didn't mean to scare ya.
The only thing that scares me, Mister  O'Connell, are your manners.
Still angry that I kissed ya, huh?
If you call that a kiss.
O'Connell reaches into the gunny-sack and starts pulling revolvers, pistols, hunting knives, a massive elephant gu and a half dozen carefully wrapped sticks of dynamite.
Did I miss something? Are we going  into battle?
The last time I was at that place  everybody I was with died.
This takes the smile off Evelyn's face. O'Connell starts  dismantling and cleaning the guns.
There's something out there, you  know, something under that sand.
Yes, I'm hoping to find a certain  artifact, a book, actually, my brother  thinks there's treasure. What do you  think is out there?
O'Connell looks into Evelyn's eyes.
Evil. The Tuaregs and the Bedouin  believe that Hamunaptra is cursed,  they call it, "the doorway to hell."
Ahmar is Ossirion. "Passageway to  the underworld", actually.
She gives him a know-it-all grin.

I don't believe in fairy tales and  hokum, Mister O'Connell, but I do  believe that one of the most famous  books in history is buried out there,  The Book Of The Living. It's what  first interested me in Egypt as a  child. It's why I came here, sort of  a life's pursuit.
And the fact that they say it's made  out of pure gold, makes no nevermind  to you, right?
Evelyn is surprised by his knowledge.
You know your history.
I know my treasure.
Evelyn gets up to go, then she hesitates, nervous, she tu back to O'Connell, and as matter-of-fact as possible says
By the way,... why did you kiss me?
O'Connell, cleaning his guns, just shrugs his shoulders.
I was about to be hanged, seemed  like a good idea at the time.
Evelyn's eyes widen, furious, she turns and storms off. O'Connell looks up, watching her leave, a bit perplexed.
What?... Wha'd I say?
Then he hears someone SNICKERING under the table. He quic reaches down, grabs that someone and lifts him up. It's B
My very good friend! What a surprise.
Why if it ain't my little buddy,  Beni. I oughta kill you.
O'Connell sticks a knife under Beni's throat. Beni swallo hard, then tries to weasel his way out with a big grin.
You never were any good with the  ladies, O'Connell.
So you're the one leading the  Americans, I shoulda figured. So  what's the scam? You get 'em out in  the middle of the desert then leave  'em to rot?
Unfortunately no, these Americans  are smart, they pay me only half  now, half when I get them back to  Cairo, so I must go all the way.
O'Connell pulls the knife away. Beni relaxes, rubs his ne
You never believed in Hamunaptra,  O'Connell. Why are you going back?  The devil himself lives out there.
They look as they hear Evelyn YELP. A single CAMEL in the HORSE PADDOCK takes another bite at her. She YELPS again backs away. O'Connell grins as Evelyn flees down the deck
The girl saved my life, figured it  was the least I could do, keep her  out of trouble.
You always did have more balls than  brains.
O'Connell's eyes narrow at the insult, he looks back at B
Let's make us even, shall we?
Even?
O'Connell grabs him and chucks him over the side of the b Beni SPLASHES into the river. O'Connell takes his gunny-s and starts walking off down the deck.
O'Connell! I am going to kill you  for this!
Sounds familiar.
And that's when he spots THREE SETS OF WET FOOTPRINTS, co up over the railing from the river and heading down the d O'Connell quickly looks around, immediately on the alert.

Evelyn, wearing a nightgown, stands in front of a mirror. She gives her head a good shake, letting her hair fall lo over her bare shoulders. Then she turns around, RIGHT THE IS ONE OF THE HIDEOUS MUMIA! It's Hook. He slams his hand over her mouth and lifts up his hook, ready to strike.
Where is the map?
Evelyn's terrified eyes glance down. Hook looks over, see the map lying next to a flickering candle on a nearby tab
And the key? Where is the key?
Evelyn's eyes look confused. She shakes her head. Hook gr
Then I'll find it myself.
He cocks his hook, about to kill her. And that's when the door is KICKED OPEN. O'Connell BURSTS IN, gun in each han Hook spins Evelyn around and holds her out in front of hi O'Connell looks at her.
Friend of yours?

Evelyn's eyes widen. And that's when the candle on the ta FLICKERS. Everything happens at once, READ FAST: O'Connel spins around just as a window BURSTS OPEN. A Mumia leans FIRES A GUN. Woodchips BLAST OFF the wall next to O'Conne head. He returns FIRE. Kills the Mumia. The Mumia falls b FIRING BLINDLY. A LANTERN in the room is BLASTED. Kerosen SPLASHES across the wall. BURSTS INTO FLAMES. Evelyn grab the candle on the table and JAMS IT back over her shoulde right into Hook's EYE. He SCREECHES in pain and lets her O'Connell grabs her and YANKS her out of the FLAMING ROOM
O'Connell pulls Evelyn down the hall, she tries to jerk f
The map! We need the map!
He shoves her up against a wall.
Relax! I'm the map! (taps his forehead) It's all up here.
Oh that's comforting.
O'Connell gives her a look, then pulls her forward.
C'mon, there's still one more of  those guys around here somewhere.

Hot melted wax covers Hook's face as he holds his sore ey and struggles to the door. Then he notices the key/box on the floor. He bends over to pick it up. And that's when t door is KICKED OPEN again, it hits him in the ass and kno him into the fire. Jonathan leans in. Sees nothing but fl
EVY!!
Then he sees the key/box on the floor and picks it up. A  HAND suddenly snatches the key/box away from him.
Hey that's mine --
It's Hook. His backside is now ON FIRE. He lifts his pist Jonathan quickly backpedals out the door as Hook OPENS FI

O'Connell and Evelyn race out onto the deck near the hors paddock. People are SCREAMING and SHOUTING, lots of panic BLAM! A chunk of the wall is BLOWN OFF next to Evelyn's h O'Connell pivots and FIRES BACK. It's the last Mumia, on other side of the paddock. He and O'Connell exchange GUNF Another LANTERN BURSTS INTO FLAMES. O'Connell SHOOTS OFF paddock lock. The horses go nuts. O'Connell FIRES over th heads. They CHARGE FORWARD and CRASH through the door. Th Mumia SCREAMS as the horses STAMPEDE over him. FLAMES swe up the walls and race across the roof. Half the barge is ON FIRE. O'Connell throws the gunny-sack over his shoulde
Can you swim?
Well of course I can swim, if the  occasion calls for it.
Trust me.
He picks her up and throws her over the side.
The occasion calls for it.
Evelyn SPLASHES into the water. O'Connell dives in after  her.
Jonathan runs out onto the bow, sees the three Americans, guns in every hand, fanning their pistols, SHOOTING every in sight. Jonathan just shakes his head.
Americans.

Hook suddenly stumbles up behind him, -- now a FLAMING TO Jonathan turns around, Hook grabs him by the throat with FLAMING ARM and pins him to the cabin wall. Jonathan's ey widen as he sees a hook rising up inside the FLAMES about strike him. The Americans pivot and OPEN FIRE. Blows Hook over the railing. Jonathan turns to the Americans and smi
I say! Good show!
Then he points his thumb at himself
And did I panic?
He lifts up his other hand, -- he has the key/box back.
I think not.
And that's when the horses STAMPEDE onto the bow. Jonatha dives over one side, the three Americans dive over the ot

O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and the Warden wade out of th water. Evelyn's nightgown clings tight to her body as she wrings it out. She looks good. O'Connell notices. Everybody else, including the horses, is getting out on t far shore O'Connell spots Beni running up to the American
Hey O'Connell! Looks to me like I  got all the horses!
Hey Beni! Looks to me like your on  the wrong side of the river!
Beni looks up at the stars, then angrily KICKS the sand  CURSING. The FLAMING barge drifts off, slowly sinking...
O'Connell barters in ARABIC with a CAMEL TRADER at a trad post. Jonathan forks over some cash. The Trader hands the the reins of four ugly old camels.
I can't believe the price of these  fleabags.
We coulda had 'em for free, all we  had to do was give 'em your sister.
Yes, awfully tempting, wasn't it?
Awfully.
And that's when Evelyn steps out of a trading tent. She's changed into a gorgeous, tightly fitted, Bedouin dress.
Then again...
O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and the warden are on camels the middle of the frying pan; the endless, sunbaked Sahar
Never did like camels. Filthy buggers.  They smell, they bite, they spit.  Disgusting.
The warden savagely attacks a chicken wing with his vile  green teeth. Flies buzz around his head. He sucks at his  gums, then spits out some gristle. O'Connell watches him.
Yeah, disgusting.
Evelyn is having the time of her life on top of her camel
Well I think they're cute.
WE DO SEVERAL TIME DISSOLVES: showing the majesty of the  desert, and our heroes getting deeper and deeper into it.

The MOON shines down an four lone camel rider's trekking  across the vast wasteland. Jonathan is sound asleep, his head bobbing comically to t rhythm of his camel. On the camel next to him, the Warden SNORES LOUDLY. Up in front of them, Evelyn slowly starts slide off her saddle. O'Connell reaches over and stops he then gently pushes her back up onto her saddle, never wak her. For a long moment, his eyes watch Evelyn, and then h looks up at a distant ridge -- -- where Ardeth Ray and a group of MUMIA RIDERS are pacin them.
The dawning sun hasn't yet crested the distant horizon as Jonathan and the Warden ride alongside a giant sand dune.
And you snore!
I do not snore!
All night you snored!
I have never snored!
Up in front of them, O'Connell looks at Evelyn.
We're almost there.
Are you sure?
O'Connell looks down at the ground.
Pretty sure.
The others look down and see DOZENS OF SKELETONS sticking out of the ground. Bleached and eaten away. Some of the  skeletons look like they're trying to crawl up out of the desert floor.
What in bloody hell is this?
The Warden shivers in fear.
Other seekers of Hamunaptra.
The American Expedition rides out from behind the far end the dune. The Americans are accompanied by TWO DOZEN NATI DIGGERS and an Arab EGYPTOLOGIST. Beni rides lead on a ca the rest ride horses.
Good morning, my friend!
O'Connell just nods. The two parties come to a stop a hun feet apart. O'Connell turns and stares out across the end horizon. Beni does likewise. The Americans look puzzled.
Well, what the hell we doin'?
Patience, my good sahib, patience.
Henderson looks over at O'Connell.
First one to the city, O'Connell!  Five hundred! Cash bucks!
O'Connell and Beni just stare out at the flat nothingness Evelyn and Jonathan share a look. And then, the SUN start to rise in the distance, breaking the flat horizon.
Get ready.
Evelyn can feel the suspense and the majesty of the momen
For what?
We're about to be shown the way.
Far off to the right, a HUGE SHAPE begins to rise with th sun. A VOLCANO. O'Connell and Beni watch it, expressionle Daniels, Henderson and Burns share a look, and then --
HEYA!
The Americans take off. Racing towards the rising volcano
SEE YA THERE, O'CONNELL!
Evelyn and Jonathan give O'Connell anxious, sarcastic loo
Ah, begging your pardon, but shouldn't  we be going?
After all, you rode us night and day  to win that bet.
O'Connell doesn't say a word, staring hard. Beni watches Americans and spits into the sand.
Fools.

And then suddenly, the volcano SHIFTS ACROSS THE HORIZON. Passing across the sun as it goes. It's a MIRAGE. The Americans crash their horses to a stop and race the o way, after the volcano. Evelyn and Jonathan smile, amazed The volcano SHIFTS AGAIN, floating across the watery hori The Americans crash to a stop again and chase after the  volcano. All three of them confused and CURSING. O'Connel and Beni just stare, waiting. The volcano SHIFTS AGAIN. A the Americans crash to a stop again. Burns is THROWN from his horse. Henderson angrily rips his hat off and chucks to the ground. Daniels just curses as they give up the ch The volcano comes to a stop on the far left of the horizo The Americans are on the far right. Nothing moves. A BEAT And then O'Connell grins. So does Beni. They share a look And then SWAT their camels and RACE AWAY. Everybody else  hauls-ass after them. O'Connell and Beni are neck-and-nec And then Evelyn comes galloping up, hair flying in the wi Beni takes out his camel whip and starts WHIPPING O'Conne Trying to knock him off his camel. once. CRACK! Twice. CR But on the third try O'Connell grabs the whip and JERKS B off his camel. Beni SLAMS to the ground and TUMBLES. Evelyn and O'Connell race across the desert. Evelyn has n felt so alive. She LAUGHS. O'Connell grins; he likes this girl. Beni stumbles to his feet, then quickly dances out the way as Jonathan and all the other riders stampede pas him. Evelyn beats O'Connell to the stone ramp, racing har
Evelyn! Slow down!
Evelyn ignores him as she races up the ramp towards the g
SLOW DOWN, EVELYN! SLOW DOWN! THERE'S  A REALLY BIG --
Evelyn goes ass-over-teacups through the air and crash la in a sand dune. She sits up, stunned, sandy hair in her e O'Connell stops at the edge of the ramp next to her camel
Never mind.
The Americans ride up and look in wonder at the ruins ins the volcano. O'Connell gives them a big, shit-eating grin
You boys owe me five hundred dollars.

Under the guidance of the Egyptologist, the Diggers are b hauling rock and dirt out of the Temple doorway. The thre Americans are playing poker. Beni smokes a hookah and swa flies. Dozens of stray CAMELS roam the decrepit city; dus backpacks and old saddlebags still slung over their humps
Where'd all these camels come from?
They belong to the dead. They will  wait years for their masters to return  before leaving.

O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and the Warden are working ne to a narrow CREVICE, which weaves it's way through the ru O'Connell ties a rope around a pillar and throws the rest the coils into the crevice, about to rappel down. Jonatha bends over to have a look, his ass hits something, he YEL and backs away. It's the decrepit FACE OF ANUBIS.
That thing gives me the creeps.
Be nice. That thing saved my life.
Evelyn is positioning ancient MIRRORS along the crevice.
That "thing" gets me excited.
(sarcastic) The things that get you excited.
According to Bembridge Scholars,  inside the statue of Anubis was a  secret compartment, perhaps containing  The Book Of The Living.
What are those mirrors for?
Ancient Egyptian trick. You'll see.
O'Connell shrugs, then rappels down into the crevice.
O'Connell waves a TORCH as Jonathan, Evelyn and the warde drop down next to him. Evelyn peers into the spooky darkn
Do you realize, we are standing inside  a room that no one has entered in  over four thousand years.
Who cares? I don't see no treasure.
You're welcome to my share of the  spider webs.
And it stinks to high heaven in here.
Evelyn just rolls her eyes.
Cretins.

Jonathan sniffs the foul air, then he looks at the warden and realizes where the smell is coming from. He stops  sniffing. Evelyn brushes COBWEBS away from a METAL DISK on the wall then repositions it on it's pedestal, aiming it at a RAY LIGHT shining in from the outer mirrors. -- THE RAY OF LI

head_text.subj: HITS THE DISK AND QUICKLY SHOOTS AROUND THE ROOM FROM ONE
DISK TO ANOTHER UNTIL THE WHOLE CHAMBER IS LIT UP. LIGHT

text: RAYS SHOOT OFF DOWN THE PASSAGEWAYS. It's the embalmer's  chamber.
That is a neat trick.
Oh my god, It's a preparation room.
Preparation for what?
For entering the afterlife.
O'Connell quickly draws his gun. Jonathan gently nudges h
Mummies, my good son, this is where  they made the mummies.
Evelyn heads down a narrow passageway. The others follow.

O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan crouch as they make their through a narrow, COBWEB INFESTED LABYRINTH. The short, s warden can stand straight up. Then they hear something an freeze. It sounds like somebody is clawing inside the wal They share looks. Then slowly move forward. Getting darke and darker as they go. The strange sound getting louder a louder. And then it stops. Evelyn holds her breath. Jonat licks his lips. O'Connell cocks his pistol. The warden FA O'Connell, Jonathan and Evelyn glare at him.

They slowly creep out of the labyrinth and up to the foot an enormous half-buried statue. The lower half of Anubis. Then they hear the sound again, coming closer now, from t other side of the statue. And closer. O'Connell pulls Eve behind him. And closer. O'Connell raises his gun. And CLO O'Connell LEAPS OUT. -- THREE HORRIBLE SWEATY FACES LUNGE HIM. O'Connell REACTS. But doesn't pull the trigger becau it's just the Americans, their guns are up, cocked and ai
Ya scared the bejeezus out of us,  O'Connell.
Likewise.
But nobody lowers their guns. Daniels grins, the tough on
This here is our statue,... friend.
Don't see your name on it,... pal.
And that's when Beni, five Diggers and the Egyptologist s out of the shadows, -- all holding guns aimed at O'Connel
Ten to one, O'Connell, your odds are  no-so-good.
I've had worse.
Jonathan clenches a tiny derringer.
Yes, me too.
O'Connell gives him a sideways glance. Beni cocks his gun grinning, he wants it to happen. The tension thickens. Th Evelyn gently takes O'Connell's gun hand and pulls it dow
Let's be nice, children, if we're  going to play together, we must learn  to share.
Evelyn pulls O'Connell away. Jonathan and the Warden foll Beni and the Americans slowly lower their guns, laughing. The Egyptologist excitedly begins translating the hierogl
O'Connell and Jonathan are using sledge-hammers against t ceiling. Evelyn is gently chipping away with a tiny chise
According to my calculations, we  should be right under the statue.  We'll come up right between his legs. (she blushes and laughs) Oh my.
And when those dirty Yanks go to  sleep -- (looks at O'Connell) No offense.
None taken.
We'll sneak up and steal that book  right out from under them.
And you're sure you can find the  secret compartment?
Yes, if their Egyptologist hasn't  already found it.
Jonathan looks around.
I say, what's our smelly little friend  got himself up to?

The Warden crawls into a DARK CHAMBER and LIGHTS A TORCH. A mural wall comes alive. Embedded into it are dozens of  black amethyst SCARABS; glittering images of the sacred  beetles. Awestruck, the Warden pulls out a pocket knife a starts prying away at one of the precious bugs.

Beni and the Americans hover around the Egyptologist, who found the SECRET COMPARTMENT inside Anubis. The Egyptolog brushes sand away from the seam. Henderson steps forward grabs the seam, -- the Egyptologist quickly stops him.
Seti was no fool.
Henderson sees the intense look in the Egyptologist's eye
Yeah, sure...
He looks back at the native Diggers.
We'll let him open it.

The Egyptologist nods, then YELLS IN EGYPTIAN at the Digg The Diggers hesitate, filled with fear. Daniels pulls out his gun, aims it at three of the Diggers. The three Digge hesitantly step forward with crowbars and stick them into the seams. The other Diggers back away, scared shitless. Beni and the Americans exchange looks, and then they back away as well.
Three Heroes are still digging into the ceiling
Lemme get this straight, they stuck  a sharp, red hot poker up your nose,  cut your brain into small pieces,  then ripped it all out through your  nostrils?
OWCH! That's really got to hurt.
It's called mummification. You're  dead when they do this
Still...
Yeah, that'd bring you back to life.
You two are worse than a couple of  schoolboys.

And that's when a huge chunk of the roof suddenly GIVES O O'Connell GRABS Evelyn and JERKS her clear. Jonathan DIVE for the far wall. A MASSIVE STONE CASEMENT DROPS OUT OF T CEILING AND CRASHES to the floor. DUST FLIES. Fills the r
Having heard the crash, Beni and the Americans have their guns pointed at the floor. The Egyptologist could care le he looks at the Diggers, gripping their crowbars, and YEL
FENI!

The three Diggers PULL HARD. The ancient seams start to g The Egyptologist YELLS again. The Diggers PULL HARDER. Th compartment starts to loosen. Again he YELLS. The Diggers give one final pull and --

head_text.subj: -- AN INTENSE BURST OF LIQUID SPRAYS OUT OF THE SEAM. HIT

text: THE THREE DIGGERS. MELTS THEIR SKIN CLEAN OFF. They SCREA Dying horribly. HALF SKELETAL by the time they hit the  ground...
The dust is starting to clear. O'Connell, Evelyn and Jona slowly get up and step over to the massive stone casement We immediately recognize it as IMHOTEP'S SARCOPHAGUS.
Oh my god,... it looks like, it looks  like a sarcophagus.
Why would they bury somebody in the  ceiling?
They didn't, they buried him at the  foot of Anubis. He was either someone  of great importance. Or he did  something very naughty.

The warden drops an amethyst-scarab into his pouch, then  greedily starts prying away at another. It rips off, he d it into his pouch, -- only he misses, and this scarab qui falls to the sandy floor without the Warden noticing. CLOSE ON: the scarab on the floor. It begins to TRANSFORM The amethyst starts to glow. Something inside starts to  WIGGLE; as if the amethyst were some sort of strange coco Then it splits open and a real live hideous SCARAB BEETLE scurries out. It races over to the warden's shoe, quickly burrows into the leather and vanishes inside. The Warden's eyes FLY OPEN. He starts to SCREAM, drops hi knife and frantically starts clawing away at his pant leg higher and higher until he rips open his shirt revealing large, hideous LUMP, BURROWING UNDER HIS SKIN. IT BURROWS IT'S WAY UP HIS FAT BELLY AND ACROSS HIS HAIRY CHEST. The Warden claws and scratches at it, trying to stop it. The  lump BURROWS UP HIS NECK. The Warden starts GAGGING and  COUGHING. And then the scarab-lump VANISHES INTO HIS HEAD.
Our Heroes clear the dirt off the top of the sarcophagus, revealing a single, ominous hieroglyph. Evelyn stares at Jonathan impatiently strums his fingers across the lid.
Well?... Who is it?
Evelyn stares at the hieroglyph, confused and concerned.
'He that shall not be named.'
O'Connell dusts off the huge LOCK
There's some sort of lock here. You  say these thing's are made of granite  with a steel interior?
Quarried granite with a cobalt lining.
Whoever's in here, sure wasn't getting  out.
No kiddin', without a key, it'll  take us a month to crack this thing,
A key! That's it! That's what he was  talking about.
Who was talking about what?
Evelyn starts rummaging through the pack on Jonathan's ba
The man on the barge. The one with  the hook, he was looking for a key.
Evelyn pulls out the key/box. Jonathan tries to take it b
Hey that's mine!

Evelyn slaps his hand and quickly unfolds the box, -- it' now shaped exactly like the LOCK'S KEYHOLE. Evelyn smiles And that's when they hear the Warden's SCREAMS echoing th the labyrinth. All three of them turn and take-off runnin

The Warden is SCREAMING and dancing insanely around the  labyrinth, totally freaked from the extreme pain in his h O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan run up just as the Warden  starts RIPPING his own hair out of his head. O'Connell an Jonathan grab at the Warden's hands, but he's far too cra he shoves them aside, runs full bore down the length of t labyrinth and SLAMS his head straight into a rock wall. T Warden drops to the ground. Dead as lead. Eyes wide open. O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan just stand there staring,  breathing hard, wide-eyed themselves...
Evelyn and Jonathan are nuzzled up to a campfire.
What do you suppose killed him?
Did you ever see him eat?
O'Connell comes up over some rocks.
Seems the Americans had a little  misadventure of their own today,  three of their diggers were killed.
How?
Salt acid. Pressurized salt acid.  Some sort of ancient booby-trap.
Maybe this place really is cursed.
A GUST OF WIND blows through the camp. The campfire FLICKERS O'Connell and Jonathan share a nerv look. Evelyn laughs.
You two!
You don't believe in curses, huh?
No. I believe if I can see it and I  can touch it, then it's real. That's  what I believe.
O'Connell cocks his rifle, KA-CHANK! Gives her a big grin
I believe in being prepared.

Jonathan opens the Warden's POUCH, the one that held the  scarabs. He reaches in, starts scrounging around. WE SLOW PUSH IN. Waiting for the attack. THE MUSIC BUILDS. And th Jonathan SCREAMS in pain and RIPS his hand back out of th pouch. O'Connell and Evelyn both jump.
WHAT?! WHAT IS IT?!
Jonathan sucks his finger, then reaches back into the pou and pulls out a LIQUOR BOTTLE, the top has been chipped o
Seagrams!
Jonathan smiles at the bottle, then turns the pouch insid out and shakes it, nothing but SAND is inside it.
Well, he may have been a stinky  fellow,... but he had good taste.

Jonathan takes a swig. O'Connell and Evelyn laugh, guilti And then O'Connell suddenly kneels down and sticks his ea to the sand. Evelyn and Jonathan watch him. A BEAT. And t a BARAGE OF GUNFIRE IS HEARD coming from the American cam O'Connell jumps up and throws the elephant gun to Evelyn.
Stay here!
He takes off running through the ruins. Evelyn immediatel gets up and runs after him. Jonathan grabs a gun, holds t bottle of Seagrams; tight and dashes after her.
Evy! Excuse me! But didn't the man  just say -- !

The American camp is under siege. Two dozen MUMIA RIDERS  gallop through. FIRING RIFLES. Several Diggers are killed they run. The Americans leap out of their tents FIRING. K multiple Riders. Daniels is shot, spins and falls, keeps  SHOOTING. Henderson and Burns run to his aid, BLASTING AW O'Connell races through the ruins and SLAMS right into Be who is obviously trying to high-tail-it out of there.
Goin' somewhere?
Just looking for you, O'Connell! I  wanted to be with my friend!
O'Connell drags him back towards the American camp.
C'mon, friend.
(struggling) Why do you like to fight so much?
'Cause I look good doin, it.

Ardeth Ray gallops through the camp, cutting Diggers down with his scimitar. O'Connell runs up on top of some rocks LEAPS OUT and TACKLES him off his horse. The two men SLAM the ground. O'Connell spins up onto one knee and FIRES, p blank. Blows the scimitar out of Ardeth Ray's hand. O'Con is about to shoot again when a horse rides up between the A scimitar swoops down, almost takes O'Connell's head off misses him by an inch. O'Connell leaps up and blows the R off his mount. The horse BOLTS. -- But Ardeth Ray is gone Evelyn hides behind some rocks, watching the scene, sudde she hears something coming up behind her and spins around A vicious tattooed Mumia Rider races at her. Evelyn quick backpedals over the rocks, terrified. The Mumia Rider rai his scimitar, about to strike. Evelyn SCREAMS, trips over a rock and FIRES the elephant  gun, -- BLAM! Blows the Rider off his mount and CATAPULTS him twenty feet back into some ruins. At the same time, the kick blows Evelyn off her feet and  over a ridge. She FLAILS through the air and lands in a s dune. Jonathan and some Diggers are holding their own near the  temple door. Four Riders come CHARGING right at them. Jonathan takes a swig off the Seagrams.
Let 'em have it, boys!
Jonathan and the Diggers OPEN FIRE. When the smoke clears the Riders are either dead or gone. Jonathan grins.
I say, bloody good show.

And then several more Mumia leap off the temple and land  behind them. Jonathan and the remaining Diggers spin arou and suddenly find themselves in hand-to-hand combat. O'Connell is quickly loading his pistol. He hears somethi THUNDERING UP behind him. He spins around just as Ardeth on a horse swings his scimitar. O'Connell instinctively r his hands to protect his face, the scimitar STRIKES! Hits his gun, -- CHING! O'Connell's gun flips away. Disar O'Connell dives and rolls and suddenly comes up with a st of dynamite in his hand. He shoves the fuse into a fire. IGNITES. He faces Ardeth Ray, towering above him. The two men lock eyes. The fuse continues to burn down. Ardeth Ra points his scimitar at O'Connell's head.
LEAVE THIS PLACE!... LEAVE THIS PLACE  OR DIE!

Ardeth Ray GALLOPS OFF. The remaining Mumia Riders race a him, vanishing into the night. O'Connell watches them lea then turns to the burning fuse,... and blows it out. Evel staggers up, looking very shaken. O'Connell gently takes and holds her close.
You alright?
Evelyn looks up into his strong eyes. It's the first time he's shown genuine concern for her. And she likes it. He' also holding her a little too close. And she likes that t
Yes,... fine,... thank you.
Beni crawls out from under some pillars as Henderson and  Burns help Daniels to his feet.
See! That proves it! Old Seti's  fortune's gotta be under this sand!
For them to protect it like this,  you just know there's got to be  treasure down there.
O'Connell looks up into the surrounding ridges, unsatisfi
These men are a desert people. They  value water, not gold.
Evelyn looks at O'Connell, suddenly very worried.
Where's Jonathan?

Jonathan falls into FRAME. Hits the ground. Eyes wide ope Mouth agape. Clearly dead. A BEAT. And then his eyes clos and his mouth widens into a goofy smile. Shit-faced drunk O'Connell and Evelyn laugh, both half-in-the-bag themselv the bottle of Seagrams is almost gone. O'Connell offers t bottle to Evelyn, she waves it away, slurring badly --
Unlike my brother, sir, I know when  to say no.
O'Connell polishes off the bottle and chucks it away.
Unlike your brother, Miss, you I  don't get. You're a whole new brew.
I know, you're wondering, what's a  place like me doing in a girl like  this?
Something like that.
Egypt is in my blood. My father was  a famous explorer, he loved Egypt so  much that he married an Egyptian. My  mother! Who was quite an adventurer  herself
Okay, I get your father, I get your  mother and I get your brother, but  what are you doing here?
Evelyn is insulted, she staggers to her feet.
I may not be an explorer, or an  adventurer, or a treasure hunter, or  a gunfighter! Mister O'Connell But  I'm proud of what I am.
And what is that?
Evelyn plops back down beside him, really drunk, she grin and proudly lifts her head high.
...I am a librarian!
She leans in, very close to his face, looks him in the ey
I'm going to kiss you, Mister  O'Connell.
No you're not.
I'm not?
Not unless you call me Rick.
Why would I do that?
Because that's my name.
She gives him a goofy smile. He leans forward and KISSES  HER. Evelyn's eyes slowly close. And then she passes out, slumping into his arms. O'Connell looks down at her, and  just smiles.

Evelyn's HAND slips the KEY into the sarcophagus, lock an turns it. A series of STRANGE MECHANICAL-LIKE SOUNDS are  heard, and then the sarcophagus unlocks with a GIANT HISS O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan all look very, very hungov They start to slide the heavy lid off the sarcophagus. PUSHING, SHOVING and GROANING, the lid budging, inch by i
I can't believe I allowed the two of  you to get me drunk.
Don't blame me, I don't even remember  being there.
Well neither do I, thank you.
O'Connell gives her a hurt look.
You don't?
Evelyn gives O'Connell a nervous look.
No... Why?... Should I?
Gee, yeah, you told me it was the  best time you ever had.

O'Connell gives her a big cheesy smile. Evelyn's face dro appalled and embarrassed. And that's when the lid FALLS O and LOUDLY CRASHES to the ground. All three of them insta grab their sore heads and MOAN.

Several fear-filled, sweaty-faced Diggers reach into the  secret compartment. Henderson and Burns hold guns on them Daniels has his arm in a sling. The Diggers slowly pull o the ORNATE CHEST. They set the chest down on the sandy fl Beni watches as the Egyptologist translates the hieratics
There is a curse upon this chest.
Curse my ass.
Yeah, who cares.
The Egyptologist gives them the evil-eye
In these hallowed grounds, that which  was set forth in ancient times, is  as strong today, as it was then.
Yeah, yeah, okay, what's it --
The Egyptologist slowly and carefully reads the inscripti
"Death will come on swift wings to  whomever opens this chest".
A GUST OF WIND blows through the chamber. TORCHES FLICKER All the Diggers suddenly turn tail and run off SCREAMING. The Americans look at each other, suddenly very nervous.
It says, there is one, the undead,  who if brought back to life, is bound  by sacred law to consummate this  curse.
Yeah, well, let's just make sure we  don't bring anybody back from the  dead then, huh?
The three Americans laugh.
He will kill all who open this  chest,... and assimilate their organs  and fluids.
Assimilate their organs and fluids?  Ya mean eat 'em?
And in so doing he will regenerate.  And no longer be the undead, but a  plague upon this earth.
The WIND WHISTLES. Torches FLICKER. VERY SPOOKY. Beni and the Egyptologist share a fear-filled look. Henderson just shrugs.
Ah hell, let's open it anyways.
WHAM! Imhotep's wooden coffin is DROPPED to the ground ne to his stone sarcophagus. Evelyn is very excited.
Oh my god, I've dreamed about this  ever since I was a little girl.
You dream about dead guys?
Evelyn just gives him a look, then starts brushing dirt a cobwebs off the top of the coffin. Then she freezes.

Look, all the sacred spells have  been chiseled off. The hieratics and  hieroglyphs that protect the deceased  on his journey into the afterlife,  they've been removed. This man was  cursed,... doomed.
O'Connell and Jonathan are too excited to care.
Tough break.
Yes, I'm all tears, now let's see  who's inside, shall we?

Evelyn can't believe these guys. Jonathan inserts the key into the coffin's lock. Turns it. The lid cracks open wit HISS. They all react to the FOUL STENCH. Then O'Connell g the lid. It's stuck. He pulls with all his might. Jonatha helps him. It starts to give way. Slowly. Slowly. Slooooo And then it suddenly POPS OPEN and THE MOST HIDEOUS, MAGG

head_text.subj: INFESTED, ROTTEN CORPSE IMAGINABLE JUMPS UP

text: AHHHHH!!!
They all jump back. Scared to death. Imhotep is now the  'Elephant Man' of corpses; twisted and deformed. The year have not been kind. He slumps back into his coffin.
Henderson and Daniels start to pry at the lid of the wood chest. Beni and the Egyptologist watch. In the background Beni starts backing away, filled with fear, sweating buck
The curse,... beware the curse!
Beni turns and bolts from the chamber. Daniels spits.
Stupid superstitious bastard.
And that's when the seal breaks, -- A BLACK VAPOR BLASTS OF THE CHEST. Everybody vanishes into the strange cloud.
O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan slowly creep forward and  carefully look back inside Imhotep's coffin, creeped-out.
Is he supposed to look like that?
No. I've never seen a mummy look  like this. He's, he's still...
Juicy?
Yes. He's more than four thousand  years old and still decomposing.
And look at this.
O'Connell points at the inside of the COFFIN LID, where t are FINGERNAIL SCRATCHES and DRIED BLOOD all over the ins
Oh my god, he was buried alive.
This sends a chill through everyone. Evelyn leans in clos
And he left a message.
WE PUSH IN on a grouping of hieratics WRITTEN IN BLOOD.
It says: 'Death is only the  beginning.'
Jonathan shivers. O'Connell looks around.
Where's my gun?
What are you going to do? Shoot him?
If he decides to wake up, hell yes!

The vapor is settling. The Americans have their guns aime at the chest. The Egyptologist slowly steps up, reaches  inside, and lifts out a heavy burlap bag. Everyone's eyes widen in excitement as he sticks his hand into the bag an slowly pulls out the black BOOK OF THE DEAD, the same boo Imhotep used in his attempt to bring Anck-su-namun back t life.
I have heard told of this book, but  I never truly believed it existed.  This, good gentlemen, is a most  priceless treasure.
Henderson kicks the sandy floor in anger.
I wouldn't trade ya for a brass  spittoon!
Yeah! It's supposed to be made outta  pure gold!
Daniels kicks the chest. It breaks open, unfolding to rev a lower compartment. Inside, are Anck-su-namun's FIVE JEW ENCRUSTED CANOPIC JARS (one is shattered and without jewe
The two camps have now joined together. O'Connell and Ben are roasting chunks of hairy meat over a fire. Jonathan  wrinkles his nose, disgusted by the smell.
What is this stuff? It smells like  our late friend, the Warden.
O'Connell and Beni both grin. Jonathan looks horrified.
You did not!?... We're not!?
Rat gizzards. They smell bad and  taste worse, but that's the best the  desert has to offer.
The gloating Americans sit down, fondling their jeweled j
Say O'Connell, whadaya think these  honey's'll fetch back home?
We hear you gentlemen found yerselves  a nice gooey mummy. Congratulations.
Ya know if ya dry him out, you can  sell him for firewood.
The Americans laugh. Evelyn walks up, sits down and drops pile of big dusty BUG SKELETONS onto the ground.
Scarabs, flesh eaters, I found them  inside our friend's coffin. They can  stay alive for years living off the  flesh of a corpse, or in this case...
She shrugs, then looks at the roasting meat
Famished.
O'Connell and Jonathan stare at the bug skeletons, disgus
Are you saying somebody threw these  things in with our guy, and they  slowly ate him alive?
Very slowly.
He certainly was not a popular fellow  when they planted him.
Must of got a little too frisky with  the Pharaoh's daughter.

According to my readings, our friend  suffered the HOM-DAI, the worst of  all ancient Egyptian curses, one  reserved for only the most evil  blasphemers. In all of my research,  I've never read of this curse actually  having been performed.
That bad huh?
Yes, they never used it because they  feared it so. It's written, that if  a victim of the HOM-DAI should ever  arise, he would bring with him the  ten plagues of Egypt.
The ten plagues?... You mean all ten  plagues.
Like what that Moses guy did to that  Pharaoh guy?
That's one way of putting it.
Let's see, there was frogs, flies,  locusts...
Hail and fire.
The sun turning black.
Water turning to blood.
And my personal favorite: people  covered in boils and sores.
All the men share nervous looks, really spooked. Evelyn j laughs at them, then pulls a meat stick out of the fire.
Fried gizzard anyone?

Having just freshened up for bed, Evelyn exits the temple and steps past the sleeping Diggers. She spots the  Egyptologist, his jeweled canopic jar snug under one arm, the Book Of The Dead laying loose under the other. Evelyn stares at the Book, nervously biting her lip, then she sn over, carefully steals it, and quickly tip-toes away. Lying on some blankets by the campfire, O'Connell rolls o and sees Evelyn, sitting wide-eyed, staring at the Book.
You sure you outta be playin, around  with that?
It's just a book, no harm ever came  from a book.
Evelyn opens the cover. THE FIRE FLICKERS. She and O'Conn share a nervous look, then Evelyn shrugs and starts readi
Ahm kum Ra. Ahm kum Dei.
Evelyn continues READING THE BOOK ALOUD IN ANCIENT EGYPTI

Evelyn's VOICE is OVERLAID as WE START WIDE on Imhotep's  chamber and SLOWLY PUSH IN on his sarcophagus. WE PUSH IN over the lip of the coffin, then closer and closer toward Imhotep's rotten, twisted head, until his putrid face fil FRAME, -- and then suddenly his crusty eyelids Pop OPEN! Revealing EMPTY SOCKETS. -- BIG SCARY MUSIC STING.
The Egyptologist sits bolt upright. Quickly looks around, sees Evelyn reading the Book. He gets up and runs for her
NO! NOOOO! YOU MUST NOT!

He skids to a stop as a strange, piercing WHINE is heard, coming from out in the desert. O'Connell and the others a leap to their feet. The Americans run out of their tents. The SOUND gets LOUDER and CLOSER. And then from out of th darkness a HUGE WALL OF LOCUSTS SWIRLS into camp and enve everyone. O'Connell grabs Evelyn, and with Jonathan at th side they race for the crevice, trying to fend off the ho vermin as they go. Beni and the Americans run for the tem The Egyptologist is covered in locusts. He stares at The  Book Of The Dead, looking haunted.
What have we done?
The campfire is SUCKED UP INTO THE AIR
O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan race down the labyrinth,  slapping at themselves and picking locusts out of their h
Did you see that!? Grasshoppers!  Billions of grasshoppers!
That's one of the plagues, right?  The grasshopper plague!
This is not a plague. It's  generational. Every so many years  the locusts of Egypt have a population  explosion and they all take flight.
Evelyn steps forward, something SQUISHES. O'Connell lower his TORCH, -- the entire floor is FILLED WITH SLIMY FROGS
Okay,... and what about frogs?

The Americans, Beni and the Diggers race into a passagewa Burns is knocked down, his bifocals skitter across the gr they get CRUSHED in the stampede. Burns staggers to his f squinting. BLURRY FIGURES vanish into the darkness,
Daniels! Henderson!

The ground under O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan starts to SHAKE. Then suddenly, right in front of them, -- HUNDREDS CHITTERING SCARAB BEETLES BOIL UP OUT OF THE SAND. Start  scurrying towards them. Evelyn SCREAMS. Jonathan SCREAMS. Even O'Connell almost screams. They turn around and haul  ass.
Burns staggers down a passageway, squinting, his hands ou in front of him, groping, trying not to bump into anythin Then ten feet in front of him, a dark, blurry FIGURE step out.
Daniels?... is that you?
Burns half-blindly staggers forward. The Figure doesn't m
Henderson?

Burns TRIPS, stumbles forward, towards the Figure, his ha reach out and SINK INTO IMHOTEP'S PUTRID CHEST CAVITY. Bu jumps like a scalded cat, pulls his hands out and looks a them, -- HIS HANDS ARE COVERED IN MOLTEN FLESH ROT. He st to SCREAM. A SKELETAL HAND clamps over his mouth.

O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan race up the staircase, jus ahead of the mass of SCURRYING, CHITTERING SCARABS. O'Connell leaps out onto a pedestal. Jonathan jumps up ne to him. Evelyn jumps up into a grotto on the other side o the narrow stairway. The horrible herd of vicious scarabs scurries between them, their ear-piercing CHITTERS send  shivers up Evelyn's spine. She leans back. THE WALL MOVES Evelyn falls backwards through an opening. O'Connell and  Jonathan watch the scarabs vanish up the staircase. Then  they look across the way. Evelyn is gone.
EVY!?

Evelyn sits up, shakes the sand out of her hair, fearfull looks around. It's almost PITCH BLACK. She gets up and fe her way along the dark walls. She rounds a corner. A shaf of MOONLIGHT filters in through a crack in the ceiling. A MAN stands in the middle of the room. Evelyn walks toward him.
Oh thank goodness, you're one of the  Americans, aren't you?

Just as she reaches him he turns around. It's Burns. BOTH HIS EYES ARE MISSING. He stares at her with vacant socket Evelyn SCREAMS in horror and backs away, hyperventilating she bumps into something. She SCREAMS again and spins aro It's Imhotep. With two fresh EYEBALLS in his sockets. Evelyn SCREAMS again and backs away into a wall. Her hair down, her face is dirty and sweaty, her blouse is ripped, her dress is torn, she's never looked sexier. Imhotep SQU
Anck-su-namun?
O'Connell is feeling his way around inside the grotto
Damn-it! Must be a trap door around  here or somethin'.
